definition:
A sequence $(s_n)$, $s_n \in \mathbb{R} $ is called *monotonically
increasing* if

$$s_m > s_n \; \forall \; m > n$$

Similarly, a real function $f(x)$ is called monotonically increasing if

$$f(x) > f(y) \; \forall \; x > y$$

Compare this to monotonically nondecreasing.

**Conflict note.** This condition is also sometimes called *strictly
increasing* [@NIST]. In such a context, “monotonically increasing” has
the same meaning as monotonically nondecreasing.

[3]{} “,” from the NIST Dictionary of Algorithms and Data Structures,
Paul E. Black, ed.
